tv.generator-info-name: WebGrab+Plus/w MDB & REX Postprocess -- version V3.0.0.0 -- build 3 -- Jan van Straaten

programme.title: Smallfoot (2018)
programme.desc: A Yeti is convinced that the elusive creatures known as "humans" really do exist

programme.title: Ready Player One (2018)
programme.desc: When the creator of a virtual reality called the OASIS dies, he makes a posthumous challenge to all OASIS users to find his Easter Egg, which will give the finder his fortune and control of his world

programme.title: Free Solo (2018)
programme.desc: Alex Honnold attempts to become the first person to ever free solo climb El Capitan

programme.title: A Quiet Place (2018)
programme.desc: In a post-apocalyptic world, a family is forced to live in silence while hiding from monsters with ultra-sensitive hearing

programme.title: The Mask (1994)
programme.desc: Bank clerk Stanley Ipkiss is transformed into a manic superhero when he wears a mysterious mask

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather. Presented by Dan Walker and Louise Minchin.(n)

programme.title: Daily Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined in the studio by food writer and journalist Jack Monroe, and the pair cook up a range of dishes to inspire viewers at home.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell visits a detached house in Colchester and a one-bedroom flat in Bellshill, North Lanarkshire, and Dion Dublin looks at a mid-terrace property in Croydon.(n)

programme.title: Night Force
programme.desc: A farmer works the night shift as two of his cows are expecting. Meanwhile, a locksmith and a plumber are called out after dark to two very different late night emergencies.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents as two more teams search for antiques in Anglesey, assisted by experts Thomas Plant and Caroline Hawley.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: The soap dispenser mystery continues to baffle Al and Bear. Meanwhile, Zara gets a shock when she discovers the cause of a young boy's stomach pains.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates a murder at the Kembleford charity treasure hunt. General suspicion falls on a bereaved man who wants revenge, but Father Brown is determined to prove he is innocent. Mystery, starring Mark Williams.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple find a characterful country house in the North Wessex Downs on a budget of Â£775,000, and also pays a visit to Highclere Castle in Wiltshire.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Upcycling expert EJ Osborne is at Woking Recycling Centre searching for three items that he can rescue and revamp, including an old bedroom cabinet and a box of wooden blocks.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: With their car boot full of antiques, Catherine Southon and Tim Medhurst head to an auction in Hertfordshire, hoping to make a profit on some old biscuit tins.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio. Presented by Alex Jones.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: In Stratford-upon-Avon, Simon and Steve want a stylish garden that mixes modern looks with heritage touches and dramatic twists, suitable for the home town of William Shakespeare. They therefore task Charlie Dimmock and Chelsea gold medal-winners Harry and David Rich to come up with something that's equal part both stylishly modern and with hints of Tudor heritage.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team bring four treasured family heirlooms back to life. The first arrival is Suzanne from London, who hopes that mechanical expert Steve Fletcher can bring a decorative wind-up bird cage that once belonged to her late mother back to its former glory. Meanwhile, church wardens Brian Tidswell and David Dickinson bring in a selection of carved angels for wood restorer Will Kirk to repair. Elsewhere, an old Georgian peat bucket and a surgeon's leather case are restored by experts Dominic Chinea and Suzie Fletcher.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The final stage of the culinary contest begins, with the four remaining contestants embarking on a culinary adventure of a lifetime on the island of Mauritius, where they will face three extraordinary challenges. The first challenge takes place in the town of Mahebourg, one of the island's earliest established fishing ports. Split into teams of two, each pair will be tasked with cooking two traditional Mauritian street food dishes for local fishermen. Next, the amateurs travel to the island's capital, Port Louis, where they have the honour of working at the Labourdonnais hotel during a busy lunch service. Finally, the contestants face the daunting challenge of creating a dinner for mentors Chef Moroogun Coopen and Chef Peeroo Nizam, as well as some of the leading figures in Mauritius' food and cultural community.(n)

programme.title: In My Skin
programme.desc: Bethan finds herself double booked when Poppy invites her to her house to study, but it is also Lydia's birthday and she wants Bethan to go out and celebrate with her. Meanwhile, Katrina is unexpectedly discharged from hospital and Bethan is worried her father will not be there to look after her properly.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer and director looks back over his career. Here, Peter voices his concerns about the environment, it's Robot Wars down at the Phoenix Club and there's a very special appearance from Alan Partridge.(n)

programme.title: Killing Eve
programme.desc: The mission in Rome is disastrously compromised. Carolyn briefs Eve on her current status as an employee of the British government and leaves her future in her own hands. Villanelle does everything she can in order to reach her ultimate target. Conclusion of the second series of the spy thriller, starring Jodie Comer and Sandra Oh.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Daily Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt and Jack Monroe are joined by a range of culinary talent from across the country by live link as they cook up another selection of dishes to inspire viewers.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The presenters follow the development of terraced houses in Walthamstow in London and Dover in Kent, and a three-bedroom semi in the Essex town of Epping.(n)

programme.title: Night Force
programme.desc: The volunteers from Northumbria Blood Bikes who transfer life-saving supplies between hospitals, and the Northern Powergrid team tackling power cuts through the night.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Kate Bliss and Ben Cooper help two teams search for items at the Newark Runway Antiques and Collectors fair in Nottinghamshire. Presented by Charlie Ross.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ruhma struggles to cope at home and turns to the one person who cannot judge her. Emma meets a demanding pregnant patient, and the soap dispenser mystery is finally solved.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The mayor is electrocuted while speaking at the Kembleford village fete, and Father Brown suspects he was the victim of a deliberate act. Meanwhile, Mrs McCarthy's past comes back to haunt her. Mystery, starring Mark Williams and Sorcha Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton looks for property on Anglesey for a couple who have a Â£475,000 budget, and also learns about the importance of preserving the island's ancient woodland.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore scours the recycling centre in Witley, Surrey, for items that can be reclaimed and given a new life, including an old aluminium trough.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Catherine Southon and Tim Medhurst's trip takes in the Shires, where Tim shares some interesting sandwich recipes and uncovers an old coffin, while Catherine finds some medals.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest. Presented by Alex Jones.(n)

programme.title: For Love or Money
programme.desc: Kym Marsh and Ashley John-Baptiste investigate a scam that saw its unwitting victim conned out of his life savings and dragged into a money-laundering ring.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests to answer questions from viewers at home on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The penultimate show sees the four amateurs being mentored by Albert Adria, one of the world's greatest pastry chefs. He welcomes the finalists into his Cakes and Bubbles restaurant in London's CafÃ© Royal, where he demonstrates two of his dishes, which they have to recreate for a table of world-class pastry experts. After this, the contestants have one final chance to impress, creating one exceptional dish for John Torode and Gregg Wallace that will showcase their growing cooking talent - knowing only three of them will make it through to the final show.(n)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: With Sasha back on fighting form, UCOS investigates the death of a talented cricket prodigy, who was the apple of his father's eye, yet loathed by his on-field team-mates. The death was recorded as misadventure but with new evidence pointing to infighting, over-zealous autograph hunters and extra marital affairs, UCOS are soon bowled over by the list of potential murder suspects. Meanwhile, wise to Steve's monetary problems, Danny appoints himself as his personal financial adviser. Detective drama, starring Larry Lamb.(n)

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg, Adam Fleming and Fergus Walsh present the latest on the coronavirus pandemic.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Daily Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by food writer and journalist Jack Monroe in the studio, as well as a range of culinary talent from across the country by live link. Together they cook up a range of dishes to inspire viewers at home.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell is in her native Scotland looking round a flat in Dumfries, as well as visiting a plot of land in Birmingham, and Martin Roberts is at a house in Abergavenny.(n)

programme.title: Night Force
programme.desc: Documentary following the lives of the army of night workers. Here, the team at one of the country's biggest shopping malls installs a three-metre tall reindeer for Christmas shoppers. In Tynemouth the biggest fish catch of the year is landed with only hours to process the catch, while refuse collectors work hard to get Newcastle's streets clean and waste recycled before dawn breaks.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp invites two teams to tour Detling Antique and Vintage Fair in Kent in search of items to take to auction in the hope of making the greater profit. They are helped on their endeavours by experts Caroline Hawley and Raj Bisram. Away from the contest, Natasha has a mystery item up her sleeve.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Rob and Karen's day off does not go to plan when a surprise visitor turns into an unwelcome guest. Shak is left reeling by Ruhma's confession, while Daniel berates Bear's lack of 'hands on' research.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest's priceless Blue Cross is targeted by infamous criminal Flambeau, so taking matters into his own hands Father Brown sets out to try to save the thief's soul, but risks falling into a trap. Mystery, starring Mark Williams.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin embarks on a house-hunting expedition in north Wales with a couple who have a Â£300,000 budget and a wish list including a craft room and community close by. Away from his quest, Jonnie cannot resist trying out Snowdonia's latest outdoor activity, catching a wave at the world's first artificial surf lagoon.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Junk rejuvenator Sarah Moore rummages through the rubbish at Dunbar Recycling Centre in Scotland, where she's on the lookout for three unwanted items that she can save from the skip. Sarah calls on carpenter Bruce Faulseit to add a modern twist to a collection of bathroom bits, while blacksmith Kev Paxton tries to find a creative new use for a galvanised metal sheet. For Sarah's own project she has three dining chairs to update.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Catherine Southon and Tim Medhurst explore the rolling Cotswold Hills in their 1970s off-roader. There are ancient artefacts, dry stone walls and lots and lots of sheep - but who will win out at the final auction in Devizes, Wiltshire?(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones brings the working week to a close with the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After an arduous eight-week journey, the search for the country's best amateur cook reaches its climax as the final three contenders push themselves to the limit for one last time before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace. This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. They must produce the best three dishes of their lives, push their culinary boundaries and deliver jaw-droppingly good food as they vie to lift the trophy and become the 16th MasterChef champion.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts the satirical current affairs quiz, with entrepreneur Deborah Meaden and comedian Phil Wang joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The Bafta-award-winning host is back to review trending news stories before welcoming another group of Hollywood A-listers and British TV big shots to chat about what they've been up to recently - or whatever else takes their fancy. Plus, the notorious Red Chair, now relocated to the comfort of a viewer's own armchair at home.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer and director looks back over his eventful career in showbusiness, joined by rock legend Noddy Holder.(n)

programme.title: Goodness Gracious Me - 20 Years Innit
programme.desc: To celebrate its 20th anniversary, this programme looks back at some the funniest and most-loved moments from the award-winning comedy sketch show, including the 10 most memorable sketches - featuring the likes of The Kupers/Coopers, Mr Everything Comes from India, Chunky Lafunga, Cheque Please and Competitive Mums - voted for by comedy fans. The programme also features a series of exclusive interviews with stars of the show, its creators and fellow comedians who are fans of the series.(n)

programme.title: Goodness Gracious Me
programme.desc: The first-ever episode of the Asian sketch show, first aired in 1998, starring Meera Syal, Sanjeev Bhaskar, Nina Wadia and Kulvinder Ghir. Highlights include life with the Coopers, nightclubbing with the Bhangramuffins, and why brown is the new black.(n)

programme.title: The Sapphires
programme.desc: An Irish music manager discovers four Aboriginal Australian singers in a remote mission in the 1960s, and plans to turn them into their country's answer to the Supremes. The naive girls face a challenging journey to stardom when they are sent to entertain American troops in the Vietnam War. Drama, starring Deborah Mailman and Chris O'Dowd.(n)

programme.desc: Our World follows two North Koreans as they gain fame in front of the camera capitalising on their defector status, yet struggle to move on from their past. (12+).(n)

programme.title: Free Will: Who Is Really In Charge Of Our Minds
programme.desc: In this fascinating journey, Melissa Hogenboom considers whether or not we are in charge of our own decisions; from neuroscience to physics to how our understanding of free will impacts on our morality and the choices we make.(n)

programme.title: The Travel Show
programme.desc: Join the team on their journey of discovery as they explore new destinations around the globe and uncover hidden sides to some of the world's favourite holiday hotspots.(n)

programme.title: The Secret World of Japanese Bicycle Racing: With Sir Chris Hoy
programme.desc: Olympic icon Sir Chris Hoy heads to Japan, host of next year's Tokyo Games, to explore the Japanese phenomenon of the keirin, the most extreme and exciting event in track cycling.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Coronavirus: What You Need to Know
programme.desc: The latest information and health advice on Coronavirus, including what the symptoms are, and how to self-isolate. Presented by Victoria Derbyshire.(n)

programme.title: The Film Review
programme.desc: Mark Kermode gives his unique take on the best and worst of the week's film and DVD releases.(n)

programme.title: The Papers
programme.desc: An early look at the next edition of the newspapers, featuring informed and engaging conversation with guest contributors.(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: The Papers
programme.desc: An early look at the next edition of the newspapers, featuring informed and engaging conversation with guest contributors.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Night Force
programme.desc: Documentary following the lives of the army of night workers who toil through the small hours to get the world ready for when the rest of the population awakes.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: John Torode and Gregg Wallace preside as the last group of six hopefuls compete in the culinary contest. They are challenged to serve up their signature dish, with the judges' favourite two winning a coveted MasterChef apron and a place in the next round. The others must come up with a dish using pigeon, beetroot and bacon in the Three Ingredients Challenge, after which two cooks are sent home, leaving the remaining four to cook two courses for three former contestants.(n)

programme.title: Lambing Live
programme.desc: As Kate Humble continues to help the Dykes with lambing on their farm in the Scottish Borders, she discovers that performing ultrasounds on sheep can be a surprisingly mucky business. Adam Henson reports from Cyprus as he goes in search of the mouflon, an ancient wild breed that is both rare and elusive. Plus, updates on the new arrivals.(n)

programme.title: Curiosity
programme.desc: Paul Martin hosts as James and Simon take on Kim and Scott, going head to head to determine who will meet today's curious collector Tanya for a chance to win Â£1,000.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize. Presented by Jeremy Vine.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Suppers
programme.desc: The food writer makes mouth-watering chocolate cookies and crispy duck with honey and figs, which prove a little bit of what you fancy does you good.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: A look through the BBC archive to discover what makes an epic, featuring interviews with some of those who starred in some of the biggest film in the world. Narrated by Sylvia Syms.(n)

programme.title: The Vikings (?)
programme.desc: A Norse warrior becomes embroiled in a feud with a former slave over the succession to the Northumbrian throne, unaware his arch-enemy is really his half-brother. Matters come to a head when they both set their sights on a Welsh princess, leading to a confrontation - but the situation is further complicated by the interference of England's sadistic king. Adventure, with Kirk Douglas, Tony Curtis, Janet Leigh, Ernest Borgnine and James Donald.(n)

programme.title: Flog It (?)
programme.desc: Five experts assess items brought to the Blickling estate in Norfolk, with David Harper excited by an early device for watching films, while David Fletcher and James Lewis reminisce about Rupert the Bear books and Dinky toys. Paul Martin enjoys a ride in a tank on historic former military camp.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games (?)
programme.desc: Mathematician Rachel Riley, singer JB Gill, newscaster Katie Derham and comedian Richard Herring take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park (?)
programme.desc: Excitement is mounting as the Park keepers hope that rare Amur tiger Yana may be pregnant. Meanwhile, a rare little Hyrax is in trouble.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Mediterranean Adventure (?)
programme.desc: The bikers ride across the Balearic islands Menorca and Majorca, sampling great produce and finding out about the British influence in the Mediterranean from the 17th century to the present day. They reveal how mayonnaise was invented in Menorca's capital of Mahon, sample Menorcan gin, and meet British chef Mark Fosh, who has lived in Majorca for more than 20 years. Recipes include cuttlefish stew and squid salad with mayonnaise, fish and chips in gin and tonic batter, and sea bass a la mallorquina and saffron potato puree.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu (?)
programme.desc: As the competition continues, chefs Tom Barnes, Sam Buckley, Hrishikesh Desai and George Farrugia compete in the heats for the North West. Each chef prepares a starter and fish course celebrating iconic food from children's literature, specifically tasked with honouring the theme of action and adventure. Presented by Susan Calman.(n)

programme.title: Devs (?)
programme.desc: Lily and her boyfriend both work as programmers at the vast campus of quantum computer company Amaya, near San Francisco. When Sergei comes to the CEO's attention, he is recruited to a secretive division of the company - but when he fails to return home, an alarmed Lily begins to investigate his disappearance. Mystery thriller created by Alex Garland (Ex Machina, Annihilation), starring Sonoya Mizuno, Nick Offerman, Zach Grenier and Alison Pill.(n)

programme.title: Mister Winner (?)
programme.desc: Jemma asks Leslie to wait in for a parcel for her while she goes to a business trip, but Leslie has other ideas and plans to go to a Dr Who convention with his best friend Cooper. Feeling guilty about letting her down, Leslie decides to cancel his day out with Cooper and stays at home to wait in for the package, which is a gift for his father-in-law. However, things do not go to plan when Leslie manages to get himself locked out of the flat, before almost burning the place down. Comedy, starring Spencer Jones and Lucy Pearman.(n)

programme.title: Mandy (?)
programme.desc: Comedy short, written by and starring Diane Morgan (Philomena Cunk). A woman becomes obsessed with a sofa she has seen in a shop window. Unable to think of anything else, she goes to desperate lengths to possess the furniture of her dreams.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight (?)
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events. Presented by Emma Barnett.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den (?)
programme.desc: Entrepreneurs pitch more money-making ideas to panellists Sara Davies, Touker Suleyman, Deborah Meaden, Tej Lalvani and Peter Jones. Two Syrian refugees share their alternative to Cypriot halloumi, a couple showcase some virus filtration gadgets, and a charitable entrepreneur has a plan for second-hand clothes. Presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Race Across the World (?)
programme.desc: The teams venture through Peru's high altitudes as the race reaches the halfway mark - but the first hurdle they face is bypassing the ongoing state of emergency in Ecuador, and drastic measures are required to ensure the competitors' safety. Emon and Jamiul are in the lead but massively over budget, so try to get work with some local fishermen, while Dom and Lizzie discover a connection to their grandmother in Peru's capital.(n)

programme.title: Hospital (?)
programme.desc: The documentary looks at Alder Hey Children's Hospital's craniofacial department - one of only four in the UK that treats life-threatening congenital skull and facial abnormalities. With a rise in referrals, the department is over-subscribed and neurosurgeon Chris Parks, who leads the craniofacial surgical team, faces a non-stop workload. Chris always works hand in glove with Ben Robertson, one of three paediatric maxillofacial surgeons in the UK. But this partnership is about to be broken up, as Ben is leaving to return to his native Australia. It takes 23 years' training to become a maxillofacial Consultant specialising in cranio-surgery, and there is currently nobody experienced enough to replace Ben, putting extra pressure on the waiting lists.(n)

programme.title: Saved on Camera (?)
programme.desc: A badly injured climber is dangling off a cliff and needs to be saved by the Mountain Rescue team. In Wales, a young boy's missing dog is found by a dog rescuer with a drone. Narrated by Kevin Duala.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two (?)
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Night Force (?)
programme.desc: Documentary following the lives of the army of night workers who toil through the small hours to get the world ready for when the rest of the population awakes.(n)

programme.title: Pointless (?)
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow (?)
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team return for a second visit to Morden Hall Park in South London, where items include letters written by Mother Teresa and a bronze by South African sculptor Anton Van Wouw. There is also a colourful collage by celebrated British artist and illustrator John Minton, and a huge collection of intricately designed silver vinaigrette boxes.(n)

programme.title: Lambing Live (?)
programme.desc: Kate Humble meets a very different kind of sheepdog, while Adam Henson learns there is much more to grass than meets the eye. Plus, a chance to catch up with all the lambs born today at the Dykes' family farm in the Scottish Borders.(n)

programme.title: Curiosity (?)
programme.desc: Sir Duke and Jeremy from the West Midlands are among the contestants taking part in the antiques game show to curate the most valuable collection, with Â£1,000 going to the winners.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads (?)
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: My Life on a Plate (?)
programme.desc: Chef Brian Turner takes guests back to their youths by visiting locations important to them and then cooking dishes inspired by their childhoods. In the first edition he is joined by cookery writer and former Great British Bake Off judge Mary Berry.(n)

programme.title: Those Magnificent Men in Their Flying Machines (?)
programme.desc: A publisher offers to sponsor the first London-to-Paris air race in a bid to boost the sales of his newspaper. Among the motley assortment of characters who sign up for the challenge is a scheming nobleman bent on sabotaging the efforts of the other entrants. Period comedy, starring Terry-Thomas, Sarah Miles, James Fox, Robert Morley, Benny Hill, Tony Hancock, Eric Sykes and Gert Frobe.(n)

programme.title: Flog It (?)
programme.desc: Catherine Southon and Nick Hall assess items brought to Boconnoc House in Cornwall, while presenter Paul martin participates in a traditional Cornish gig race.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games (?)
programme.desc: Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley, singer JB Gill, newscaster Katie Derham and comedian Richard Herring compete to see who can master the tasks set by Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park (?)
programme.desc: The vets operate on Violet the koala to investigate her breathing problems, and the keepers wonder which will come off worst when a tree porcupine comes face to face with a skunk.(n)

programme.title: The Lakes with Paul Rose (?)
programme.desc: The explorer digs out his rucksack and heads for Windermere in the Lake District. The National Park attracts 18 million visitors each year, and is now a World Heritage site. Here, Paul finds out why the early tourists thought the Lakes was one of the most dangerous spots in the country. He also plunges into the world of long-distance swimming and helps the staff who run the boats on the lake and meets a Holocaust survivor who was airlifted to Windermere in 1945 as part of a mercy mission involving 300 orphans after the Second World War.(n)

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Lochs (?)
programme.desc: Paul Murton travels from the shores of Loch Hope to the lonely expanse of Sandwood Bay in the far north-west. Along the way he discovers wartime secrets in Loch Eriboll, crosses a subterranean loch and learns the art of drystone dyking from a master craftsman in Kinlochbervie.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu (?)
programme.desc: The chefs from the North West cook mains and desserts celebrating children's literature, and while one takes inspiration from JM Barrie and his own imaginary feast, the other two choose Beatrix Potter, leaving judge Michael O'Hare to decide which lamb dish is better.(n)

programme.title: Devs (?)
programme.desc: Lily's investigation leads her to the man who knows Sergei's secrets, and stirs suspicion about her employer, Forest. But when he tries to throw her off the scent, she becomes more driven to find answers, and turns again to Jamie - although he is concerned how she will act upon whatever he finds. Mystery thriller, starring Sonoya Mizuno, Nick Offerman, Zach Grenier and Alison Pill.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo (?)
programme.desc: Sindhu Vee hosts this episode of the comedy showcase recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo, featuring stand-up performances by New York-based Edinburgh comedy award winner Alex Edelman, and at the Edinburgh Festival Fringe Comedians' Choice Award winner Lou Sanders.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight (?)
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: Front Row Late (?)
programme.desc: Host Mary Beard gets to grips with the latest broadcast technology as she aims to present the latest series of the arts review show from her study each week. And with cultural institutions around the country closed, the programme aims to bring content alive through interviews, discussions and exclusive performances from leading writers, artists, actors and musicians. The first show features an exclusive puppet production based on a short story by Edgar Allan Poe, created in confinement in Canada by leading author Margaret Atwood and her sister Ruth.(n)

programme.title: Villages by the Sea (?)
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson examines the history of the Lancashire village Sunderland Point, which is cut off twice a day by the tide and has become a haven for wildlife. He reveals it was once a busy port that was instrumental in the slave trade, and at the forefront of the luxury goods business that transformed 18th-century Britain..(n)

programme.title: MasterChef (?)
programme.desc: Six heat winners return for the quarter-final, fighting for a place in Knockout Week. Facing the Critic's Test, the week's best-performing amateurs take on an intimidating task - cooking to a brief set by food writer Jimi Famurewa, who asks for a dish inspired by flavours of the sweet shop. Presented by John Torode and Gregg Wallace.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Mediterranean Adventure (?)
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the culinary delights of Sardinia, starting out in Cagliari, where everyone is in high spirits for the feast of St Efisio. The bikers join in by cooking a local speciality, almond and orange cakes. They also meet the tuna fishermen of Carloforte and a chef who has a special way of serving up platters of the fish, are shown how to make sheep's black pudding by a group of shepherds and are served a stew by the 'King of Sardinia'.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two (?)
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Night Force (?)
programme.desc: Documentary following the lives of the army of night workers who toil through the small hours to get the world ready for when the rest of the population awakes.(n)

programme.title: Pointless (?)
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for.. (?)
programme.sub-title: Back in Time for the Corner Shop
programme.desc: The Arderns reflect on the lessons learned through the series, and how corner shops can continue to thrive in the changing world of 21st-century business. The programme examines how shops have reinvented themselves to compete with mini-supermarkets, the rise of zero-waste shops, and how other businesses, like cafes, coffee shops and micro pubs, are filling the role of community hub.(n)

programme.title: Lambing Live (?)
programme.desc: As the week of broadcasts from the Dykes' family farm in the Scottish Borders draws to a close, Kate Humble learns about the dedication and attention to detail it takes to raise lambs for their meat. Adam Henson looks at the future of breeding as he encounters some test-tube sheep, and there is a last update about the new arrivals in the lambing sheds.(n)

programme.title: Curiosity (?)
programme.desc: Paul and Lin from Dorset take on Anne-Marie and Morgan from Nottingham in an antiques challenge to curate the most valuable collection. Presented by Paul Martin.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads (?)
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever (?)
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of recipes from the BBC archives for party food, including Lorraine Pascale's white chocolate lollipops, seafood dishes by James Martin and Rachel Khoo's coq-au-vin on a stick.(n)

programme.title: Natural World (?)
programme.desc: The wildlife of the Highlands, seen through the eyes of naturalist Fergus Beeley, who spent a year at Loch Maree and the surrounding hills. He follows the fortunes of rare black-throated divers and white-tailed sea eagles, and films the red deer and salmon whose lives revolve around the loch.(n)

programme.title: Swallows and Amazons (?)
programme.desc: Four youngsters go boating while on holiday in the Lake District where they encounter two more children with a boat of their own, and a rivalry develops over a series of escapades. Family adventure, based on Arthur Ransome's classic novel, starring Virginia McKenna, Ronald Fraser, Sophie Neville and Simon West.(n)

programme.title: Flog It (?)
programme.desc: At Oxburgh Hall in Norfolk, David Harper is excited by a Polynesian war club, while Philip Serrell falls for a sewing machine dating back to 1875. Presenter Paul Martin uncovers the history of the Bedingfeld family, whose members have called Oxburgh home for 500 years - and managed to keep their heads on their shoulders.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games (?)
programme.desc: Mathematician Rachel Riley, singer and farmer JB Gill, radio presenter Katie Derham and comedian Richard Herring test their general knowledge skills, with an overall champion being crowned for the week.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park (?)
programme.desc: After weeks of speculation, Kate Humble and Ben Fogle reveal that the signs are that rare Amur tiger Yana is definitely pregnant. Anxious not to miss the historic birth of cubs - the first at the Park for nearly 20 years - keepers install special cameras in the Tiger House, which will also enable them to closely monitor Yana's heath at a safe distance. Plus, Jean Johansson discovers why coconuts are just the job for the dental health of Cape Porcupines.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Secret France (?)
programme.desc: The chef concludes his tour with trips to the Languedoc and Provence. In the border town of Uzes, Rick samples salt cod and marvels at a colourful array of French patisserie - selecting a seasonal fig tart to have with his morning coffee. He moves on to the harbour town of Cassis to try North African lamb chorba cooked by a local fisherman, while back in his country kitchen, he prepares a confit tomato and aubergine tarte tatin.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World (?)
programme.desc: The green-fingered team guides team enthusiasts through seasonal highlights from across the country visiting stunning gardens, meeting the gardeners and finding out their secrets of success. Monty Don and faithful hounds Nigel and Nellie are at Longmeadow to bring inspiration as well as outline all the essential gardening jobs for this weekend. Co-presented by Joe Swift.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu (?)
programme.desc: The two highest scoring chefs from the North West go head to head to cook their six-course menus again. Not only do they need to impress food writer Matthew Fort, restaurateur Oliver Peyton and broadcaster and cook Andi Oliver, but also bestselling children's author and Laureate between 2011 and 2013 Julia Donaldson, who has sold over 65 million books worldwide and been translated into over 75 languages. Presented by Susan Calman.(n)

programme.title: Natural World (?)
programme.sub-title: Pangolins - The World's Most Wanted Animal
programme.desc: Documentary examining attempts to save the most illegally trafficked animals in the world - a little-known scaly mammal called the pangolin. Based in Namibia, conservationist Maria Diekmann rescues and rehabilitates these local creatures. Cameras follow her to Vietnam, Thailand and China - into the heart of the crisis, where demand for pangolin products is greatest.(n)

programme.title: The Mash Report (?)
programme.desc: A self-isolated Nish Kumar hosts Britain's most uncompromising topical satire, tackling all the troubling news from a world that's put its faith in Boris Johnson and Donald Trump. His similarly quarantined correspondents, include Ellie Taylor and Steve N Allen.(n)

programme.title: The Mini Mash Report (?)
programme.desc: Nish Kumar and comedy correspondents Rachel Parris, Ellie Taylor and Steve N Allen present the satirical and surreal take on everything that happened in the week the programme first aired in May 2019.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight (?)
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, with Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: Cold in July (?)
programme.desc: A small-town man is hailed as a hero after he shoots dead a burglar who had broken into his home. He begins to fear for his life when the thief's father turns up seeking revenge, which is only the first in a series of events that plunge his simple life into chaos. Crime thriller based on Joe R Lansdale's novel, starring Michael C Hall, Sam Shepard and Don Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc: A look at the work of the Hamadas, one of Japan's most famous families of potters, following Tomoo as he creates and fires pots in a wood-fuelled kiln.(n)

programme.title: Six Wives with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: The historian explores the fate of the last three wives of Henry VIII. First, Lucy witnesses Henry's doomed courtship with Anne of Cleves, with Henry successfully reneging on their marriage having claimed it had yet to be consummated. Two weeks later, Henry married teenager Catherine Howard, but an act of adultery with a courtier saw the young woman convicted of treason and beheaded. Finally, Lucy explores Henry's relationship with his last wife Katherine Parr, and how she managed to win Henry round despite their greatly differing religious beliefs.(n)

programme.title: Rebuilding Notre Dame: Inside the Great Cathedral Rescue
programme.desc: Following efforts to rebuild the world-famous Cathedral of Notre Dame de Paris, a year on from the devastating fire that ravaged the 850-year-old Gothic masterpiece. Chief architect Philippe Villeneuve urgently needs a complete picture of the damage sustained during the fire, so he initiates an unprecedented collaboration between architects and scientists. Their mission is to meticulously analyse the fallen timber, stone and fractured glass, to develop a decontamination and restoration plan. This unique opportunity offers a new insight into the medieval materials, techniques and people who built Notre Dame.(n)

programme.title: From Ice to Fire: The Incredible Science of Temperature
programme.desc: Physicist Helen Czerski explores the science of temperature. She begins by venturing to the bottom of the scale, revealing how cold has shaped the world and why frozen does not necessarily mean what people might think.(n)

programme.title: From Ice to Fire: The Incredible Science of Temperature
programme.desc: Physicist Dr Helen Czerski explores the narrow band of temperature that has led to life on Earth. She reveals how life began in a place where hot meets cold, and how every living creature on Earth depends on temperature for its survival. She uncovers the extraordinary natural engineering that animals have evolved to keep their bodies at the right temperature and she witnesses the remarkable surgery that is using temperature to take the human body to the extremes.(n)

programme.title: Arthur
programme.desc: Sue Ellen is excited to meet her pen pal in person, but is disappointed when she realises they do not have as much in common as she thought.(n)

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed
programme.desc: Dennis is mistaken for a Beanotown Baddie while in disguise to sneak into a 12A film. At first he loves being treated like a celebrity, but as things begin to go awry his friends have to save him by revealing his real identity and capturing the real diamond stealing baddie.(n)

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: Mouse buys a video game that is supposed to teach the family teamwork.(n)

programme.title: Class Dismissed
programme.desc: Following four year 8 pupils - Billy, Tahj, Emily and Jasmine - as they grapple with everyday life at an extraordinary school. Narrated by Bill Turnbull.(n)

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: Reality-style drama series. Surprising new friendship dynamics arise as TNS gears up for the dance convention.(n)

programme.title: Junior Bake Off
programme.desc: Sam Nixon and Mark Rhodes present the competition to find Britain's best junior baker, with the youngsters creating a pineapple and blueberry upside-down cake.(n)

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience.(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Adventures of Professor Branestawm
programme.desc: Harry Hill takes the title role of the absent-minded inventor, who is oblivious to the chaos caused by his ridiculous creations when they go wrong - which is more often than not. Luckily, his long-suffering housekeeper Miss Flittersnoop and dim-but-loyal best friend Colonel Dedshott are on hand to make sure he doesn't blow himself to smithereens. However, the trio meet their match when a local councillor tries to run the professor out of the village for being a dangerous nuisance, so Miss Flittersnoop's science-mad niece Connie comes to their aid. Comedy drama, co-starring Vicki Pepperdine, Simon Day and Madeline Holliday, with David Mitchell, Miranda Richardson and Ben Miller. Written by Charlie Higson from the popular children's books by Norman Hunter.(n)

programme.title: Absolute Genius with Dick & Dom
programme.desc: The work of Alexander Fleming, the scientist who discovered penicillin. Inspired by his ideas, the duo try to come up with their own, and attempt to turn germs into works of art.(n)

programme.title: Operation Ouch
programme.desc: The Doctors take a dip in the sea to reveal how your sensory neurons detect when something is hot or cold, and they find themselves getting stuck in the mud when they join Her Majesty's Coastguard in Operation Takeover. Meet two more new Ouch Patients, and find out what to do if someone is unresponsive and not breathing in First Aid. Meanwhile in Accident & Emergency one patient arrives with a broken arm after an accident on a trampoline and another is treated for busted thumb.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall sets out to visit six continents in search of Earth's 60 deadliest animals.(n)

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience.(n)

programme.title: Gym Stars
programme.desc: Amelie, Phoebe and Cameron are ready for competition at the British Championships. Narrated by London Hughes.(n)

programme.title: Gym Stars
programme.desc: It's the final day of the British Championships and Zoe competes for the first time as a senior.(n)

programme.title: Holly Hobbie
programme.desc: Holly, Amy and Piper discover that the local pickle factory is polluting the nearby creek..(n)

programme.title: The Dumping Ground
programme.desc: Visitors gather to watch videos made by Ashdene Lodge residents about their lives there, with the focus turning on Tyler's classic moments. Drama based on books by Jacqueline Wilson, starring Miles Butler-Hughton.(n)

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: A young boy called Aron loves all things Bollywood, especially dancing, so the team builds him his very own Bollywood-style den.(n)

programme.title: Millie Inbetween
programme.desc: Mike and Mum seem to be bickering all the time.(n)

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: When the world is in jeopardy, only a 1,000ft Penfold can save everyone. With the voices of Alexander Armstrong and Kevin Eldon.(n)

programme.title: Diddy TV
programme.desc: Diddy Dick and Dom host a line-up including dancing diddies in 'The Diddy Step', music in 'Diddy Pops' and a heartbreaking documentary about a boy with a spoon for a nose.(n)

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed
programme.desc: Mrs Creecher uses the school's allotment to hold Class 3C's Biggest Veg competition. Determined to outshine Walter, Dennis will do anything to grow the biggest veg.(n)

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: Mouse buys a video game that is supposed to teach the family teamwork.(n)

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience.(n)

programme.title: Hey You What If
programme.desc: Find out why stopping the earth from spinning isn't such a good idea..(n)

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Specialist agents investigate all sorts of strange and weird happenings in their town by calling on their skills in mathematics and numeracy. Olive and Otto must stop zeroes from disappearing before the missing digits destroy the town.(n)

programme.title: Danny & Mick
programme.desc: Danny accidentally orders 10,000 toilet rolls and needs to hide them from the boss.(n)

programme.title: Secret Life of Boys
programme.desc: Comedy drama series, following Ginger Boxwell who lives with her aunt, uncle and four cousins. Erica Brown stars.(n)

programme.title: Gym Stars
programme.desc: Shakiem and Seb hope to shine at the Tumbling British Championships, while Alice is on a planet-saving mission!(n)

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: Is the Baltic Sea Anomaly really a UFO that crashed into the ocean 600 years ago? Ant thinks it is. But what the Nektons find inside is even more strange and frightening.(n)

programme.title: Hetty Feather
programme.desc: Hetty is forced to return to Calendar Hall to save the day and Mathias waits for Harriet..(n)

programme.title: Hank Zipzer
programme.sub-title: The Curtain Went Up, My Trousers Fell Down
programme.desc: The school play is looming and Hank is the lead star, but he is struggling to remember his lines and is facing trouble from school bully McKelty. Fortunately, he finds an unlikely ally in his maths tutor Heather.(n)

programme.title: Gym Stars
programme.desc: Shakiem and Seb hope to shine at the Tumbling British Championships, while Alice is on a planet-saving mission!(n)

programme.title: Show Me Show Me
programme.desc: Miss Mouse is a scurrying lizard, and Chris Jarvis and Pui Fan Lee discover precious fossils that are even older than Chris' old socks.(n)

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The friends eat too much and feel full, and after seeing someone pour water into a glass, they get carried away finding their own containers to fill.(n)

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: When Po goes on the Tubby Custard Ride it makes lots of Tubby Custard - too much for Po to eat alone. So, the Teletubby choo-choos off to get Tinky Winky, Dipsy and Laa-Laa so all of the Teletubbies can share it. In Tummy Tales, children take a ride on a steam train.(n)

programme.title: Timmy Time
programme.desc: The sheep paint portraits of one another, but argue about who has the bigger brush.(n)

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: The friends gather for a tea party, but the bunny accidentally tips one of the bakes off its stand. He is upset that it is ruined, but Amma helps him see things differently.(n)

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: The bunny helps do the shopping at Padget's shop, and cannot resist putting a strawberry lolly in his pocket while Flop is paying. The pair must then decide what to do.(n)

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Norrie is upset when a leaf falls from a tree, and Roly finds an acorn stuck to his bottom, prompting the squirrels to search for more to share out.(n)

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The dog blows up balloons for Tino's birthday, but the squirrels are worried because the artistic mouse is known for being somewhat grumpy.(n)

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.sub-title: Go Jet Academy: Sea Arch Escape
programme.desc: Cartoon following four adventure-seeking superheroes as they explore places all around the world.(n)

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale of Mr Tod's Trap
programme.desc: When Peter, Benjamin and Lily are tempted by a mysterious hoard of radishes, Lily finds herself caught in Mr Tod's trap. Can Peter find a way to rescue Lily before Tod reaches her?(n)

programme.title: Bitz & Bob
programme.desc: With Bitz on drums, Bob on guitar and Bevel on vocals, the Booyahs are ready to perform.(n)

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: The crew tries to rescue Peso when he becomes trapped inside a giant jelly.(n)

programme.title: Biggleton
programme.desc: When a pirate arrives in town, the people of Biggleton help find her lost treasure.(n)

programme.title: Justin's House
programme.desc: Justin and Robert are given some very pungent cheese, but the horrible smell makes Little Monster run away and attracts the attention of Funella Furchester and a cheeky mouse. Guest starring Louisa Gold.(n)

programme.title: Raa Raa the Noisy Lion
programme.sub-title: Raa Raa and The Banana Balloons
programme.desc: It's Banana Day in the Jingly Jangly Jungle and Huffty gives everyone a banana balloon to play with - but while Raa Raa's friends are playing Banana Day games, Raa Raa doesn't seem quite himself.(n)

programme.title: Timmy Time
programme.desc: The lamb decides to have a day collecting blue toys, cushions and paint, but finds he needs more than one colour to create a picture.(n)

programme.title: Dog Loves Books
programme.desc: While trying to solve a puzzle, Dog and Pug end up looking for a Minotaur in an old maze..(n)

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Pando insists on one last game of hide and seek and finds a great hiding place under Bing's bedcovers, but by the time the bunny finds him he is fast asleep.(n)

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos hide underneath different hats at a shop, and back on the boat, Box brings a rainbow for everyone to dance under.(n)

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin Fletcher and his friends go on an adventure to a dinosaur park. Meanwhile, Mr Tumble visits Shopkeeper Tumble in The Shop with the Lot to buy Tumble Ted a birthday present.(n)

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies are about to go on the Tubby Custard Ride with the hat, bag, ball and scooter when they realise there is not enough room. The Noo-noo looks after their things.(n)

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The dog and the squirrels decide to play hide-and-seek and Duggee finds them all except Roly.(n)

programme.title: Let's Play
programme.desc: Rebecca becomes a knight, and tries to save the princess from a tower and out-run the fire-breathing dragon.(n)

programme.title: Pablo
programme.desc: A little boy journeys from real-life into the animated art world he creates, where his friends help him handle situations that make him feel anxious.(n)

programme.title: Patchwork Pals
programme.desc: Animation following the adventure of a group of animals living on a patchwork blanket.(n)

programme.title: Our Family
programme.desc: Finlay and his family visit a big castle and look for fairies in the grounds. Later, it's all aboard a boat as they head out to sea on the lookout for seals.(n)

programme.title: Tinga Tinga Tales
programme.sub-title: Why Caterpillar Is Never in a Hurry
programme.desc: Animals rush around to get ready for a parade, while Caterpillar is happy to sit in a tree and munch on leaves.(n)

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Jake is making traditional Australian meat pies filled with lamb mince.(n)

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: The Brooklyn-Bells take Waffle to school to ask the headteacher if Waffle can visit class.(n)

programme.title: Timmy Time
programme.desc: The friends try different forms of dancing, but cannot get them right.(n)

programme.title: Gigglebiz
programme.desc: Live-action comedy sketch show for the under-sixes, starring Justin Fletcher.(n)

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: The seven-year-old girl and her pet duck chance upon an exciting discovery while racing paper planes.(n)

programme.title: Kit and Pup
programme.desc: Kit and Pup are at the beach.(n)

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Fun and games with words beginning with 'th', including thing, this, that, thick, thin and them.(n)

programme.title: Yakka Dee
programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say â€˜bath' and we go on a whirlwind word adventure.(n)

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: The Numberblocks show viewers what they are made of in a song and dance all about the parts that make a whole.(n)

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Sula and Bing help Amma to get lunch ready.(n)

programme.title: Messy Goes to OKIDO
programme.desc: Science-educational series following a curious, adventure-seeking and unruly monster as he finds the answers to everything a pre-school child would want to know.(n)

programme.title: What's the Big Idea
programme.desc: Hugo learns that an ant is incredibly strong for its size during a strength contest.(n)

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin and his friend pretend to be superheroes for the day. Meanwhile, Super Tumble goes to the rescue of Shopkeeper Tumble, Baker Tumble and Aunt Polly.(n)

programme.title: Mister Maker's Arty Party
programme.desc: Mister Maker, the Mini Makers from Glasgow and Scrappz have an Arty Party all about faces, and discover how an artist called Frida Kahlo turned her face into famous paintings.(n)

programme.title: Ferne and Rory's Vet Tales
programme.desc: Rory visits Porter and his pet bearded dragon, Beardy, who has a poorly tummy and needs a trip to the vet. Ferne joins a mobile vet on the Isle of Wight, where they visit lots of pets who need care.(n)

programme.title: Catie's Amazing Machines
programme.desc: Rally driver Catie shows off three amazing machines that belong on water. She tries out a water scooter, visits the largest cruise ship in the world and then pilots a speedy yacht.(n)

programme.title: Swashbuckle
programme.desc: Cook and Line help a little sea monster collect donations of gold for a 'Save the Sea Monsters' charity.(n)

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels are playing with their toys when they notice that there are sheep in the clubhouse. Animation for children aged two to five.(n)

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale of Nutkin on the Run
programme.desc: When Squirrel Nutkin upsets Old Brown by taking his glasses, it is up to Peter and his friends to put things right.(n)

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Love Monster finds it difficult when everyone has to do things the opposite way around..(n)

programme.title: Andy's Dinosaur Adventures
programme.desc: Andy Day travels back 220 million years to the era of the postosuchus - a giant creature that roamed North America in the time of the earliest dinosaurs.(n)

programme.title: Maddie's Do You Know
programme.desc: Maddie learns how spiders make webs with silk and how watering cans are made in a factory.(n)

programme.title: Bitz & Bob
programme.desc: Bitz, Queen of Speed, Bevel the Blaze, Pacey Purl, Robo-Blast Bob, Pop the Snow Pro, and Zip the One Throw Wonder compete in Snowy Sports Day, but cannot keep track of the scores.(n)

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Cartoon following four adventure-seeking superheroes as they explore places all around the world.(n)

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Waffle's been awarded the class toy for good behaviour, and Zoe and Callum have big news..(n)

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.sub-title: It's Time to Visit the Farm
programme.desc: JoJo is excited to show Gran Gran around the city farm - it's been a few months since she was last there, and she can't wait to see Melanie the chick again. But when they arrive at the chicken enclosure, they can't find the little fluffy chick - where could she be?(n)

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: The duo are woken by a loud clanging and decide to investigate.(n)

programme.title: Moon and Me
programme.desc: Mr Onion is playing quietly with his toy bridge when he is interrupted by Little Nana and Lambkin, playing a noisy hopping game.(n)

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: Two hoots come to visit the Clangers. Tiny wants Big Hoot to play a duet with her.(n)

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: Everything in the garden is noisy, so Igglepiggle moves away to find a quiet place.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Totally Bonkers Guinness World Records
programme.desc: Matt Edmonds narrates a selection of some of the most incredible and peculiar record-breaking attempts, including the most snails on one person's face, the fastest time to tape a person to a wall, and the quickest consumption of a raw onion.(n)

programme.title: The Ellen DeGeneres Show
programme.desc: Natalie Portman joins the host to discuss starring in sci-fi drama Lucy in the Sky. Plus, Mario Lopez has all the latest from the world of Access Hollywood.(n)

programme.title: You've Been Framed
programme.sub-title: You've Been Framed! Gold: Full Throttle
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a selection of comical clips filmed by viewers on their camcorders and mobile phones, featuring thrill-seekers, show-offs, below-the-belt mishaps and painful-looking accidents.(n)

programme.title: You've Been Framed
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers. A squirrel steals a mobile, a fox attacks a golfer and a beach wedding is ruined. Plus, a skunk stinks out a swimming pool and a toddler murders a smurf.(n)

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: New Cloud 9 superstore employee Jonah makes a terrible first impression on long-standing floor supervisor Amy. Assistant manager Dina soon becomes interested in him. US sitcom, starring America Ferrera.(n)

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: Cheyenne and her fiance come up with a jingle for the store, and Garrett tries to avoid being photographed for the article for the store for the company magazine.(n)

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: Wesley from York appraises five menus put together by would-be sweethearts, and must decide which three he would like to meet based on the meals they have planned.(n)

programme.desc: Three singletons try to impress professional footballer Osebi in Manchester, who then goes on a date with the person whose taste in clothes he liked best.(n)

programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity edition of the game show, asking former professional boxer Tony Bellew, singer and fashion designer Kelly Osbourne and BBC Breakfast presenter Dan Walker to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, featuring children performing a stage version of The Exorcist instead of a Nativity Play, a stripping grandmother and a dog that ruins a living room. programme.desc: Sasha from London is asked to choose which three blind dates from a selection of five potential suitors she would like to get to know better, based entirely on dinner menus they have created.(n)

programme.desc: In London, coffee shop supervisor Holly, singer Millie and care assistant Megan seek out stylish outfits for actor John, in the hope he may select one of them for a date.(n)

programme.desc: Amy is angry when Glenn asks only the employees of Hispanic descent to work on a salsa sample booth. Jonah is tasked with giving out flu shots in the pharmacy.(n)

programme.title: Superstore (?)
programme.desc: Everyone becomes obsessed with a mannequin that looks exactly like Jonah, Cheyenne considers putting her baby up for adoption, while Glenn and Dina get into an argument about parenting. Comedy, starring America Ferrera and Ben Feldman.(n)

programme.title: You've Been Framed (?)
programme.desc: Exploding toilets, airborne chainsaws and a cat with a talent for playing the drums are among the video highlights submitted by fans for comedy appraisal by Harry Hill. programme.desc: Harry Hill's unique observations. Balcony theft goes wrong in the Home Counties, light bulbs are used as shuttlecocks, and the world's most inappropriate birthday present.(n)

programme.desc: Internet billionaire Walden plans to work his way back into the affections of his ex-wife Bridget, and asks Alan to accompany him as he tries to put his plan into action. Comedy, guest starring Judy Greer.(n)

programme.desc: Joe's long-estranged father Bud visits Quahog, while Stewie is told that he will never grow tall and so befriends a pint-sized version of Tom Cruise.(n)

programme.desc: While exploring an abandoned asylum to gain inspiration for filming a new horror movie, Peter and his friends accidentally kill a man who they think is keeping them hostage. Meanwhile, Stewie becomes annoyed with Brian's pretentious attitude.(n)

programme.desc: The boys face uncertainty when their landlord evicts them without notice from their flat. programme.desc: Jason's brother Darius is getting married and Marcus desperately wants to hire out the Crown and Toga for the occasion, while Grumio offers his services as wedding planner. programme.title: Family Guy (?)
